page.title: 08HEWLETT-PACKARD
page.content: Hewlett-Packard are an American owned high technology company, specialising in building computer components. They acquired their present site from the Duke of Beaufort about 3 years ago, and much of the 186 acres is already developed. The main factory covers 125,000 square feet and is on an open plan construction. Micro-chips are made on this site (some have a value of over Â£1,000) as are floppy discs, disc drives and micro drives. At present 320 people are employed. All of the machines that make the components are computer controlled, so most of the staff are administrative. This factory in Bristol (sited close to the M4) is one of 4 in the U.K. Many of the products are exported to over 60 countries.
